intro: Stadtmannia excelsa, commonly known as the giant flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of northeastern Australia. It is characterized by its massive, umbrella-shaped canopy and its ability to grow to heights exceeding 30 meters. The plant features large, glossy, dark green leaves that are often clustered at the ends of its long, drooping branches. Its most distinctive feature is its showy, red and orange floral display, which appears in late winter to early spring. Stadtmannia excelsa is a fast-growing species that thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil.
